MYB Pipeline¶

class pybart.pipeline.myb.mybpipeline.MybPipeline(parent, display=None)¶

Pipe line use to compute epochs to determine the likelihood

compute_likelihood(l_r_TNT, l_mu_TNT_T, l_mu_TNT_NT, l_sigma_TNT_T, l_sigma_TNT_NT)¶

Compute likelihood value for Target and NoTarget

new_epochs(label, epochs)¶

This function is a slot who classifies epoch according to learning parameters and bayes priors for myb games with dynamic bayesian classification

Parameters

  • label (str) – This is the label of the epochs stack

  • epochs (numpy.ndarray) – This it a matrix 3d (times*channels*stack)

This is the most important part of the class. Each stack of epoch build by the StreamEngine arrives here with his label.

predict_R_TNT(X, mu_MatCov_T, mu_MatCov_NT)¶

Predict the r_TNT for a new set of trials.

setting()¶

This function is use to configure the pipeline.

Here it just show the the UI setting interface. Every needed tools and parameters to configure the pipeline are in.

This function is call by the configuration panel, when setting button is clicked.

start(low_frequency, high_frequency, trig_params, stream_params)¶

On configure the Steam engine

  • the pass band-frequency

  • the epochs output slot

Then get the StreamEngine communication inferface (sender) with the myb game and reset it.

class pybart.pipeline.myb.mybsetting.MybSettingDialog(parent)¶

Dialog window to setup the myb pipeline

connect_ui()¶

function connecting all visual component with action

load_template()¶

Read “.h5” file and store content in a dictionnary

on_run_calibration()¶

Function check calibration arguments validity and run the thread

on_select_calibration()¶

Path selection of BrainVision (.vhdr) file use to calibration

on_select_template()¶

Path selection of .h5 file use to calibration

on_step()¶

Update the calibration progress bar

on_template_generated()¶

When the template generation is finish the function reset element

pybart.pipeline.myb.mybtemplatecalibration.filtering_raw(raw, l_freq, h_freq)¶

This function filtering a raw format without using forward-backward method

Parameters

  • raw_events (mne.io.Raw) – mne tools storing raw data from a BrainVision Recorder

  • l_freq (float) – Low frequency of the pass band.

  • h_freq (float) – High frequency of the pass band.

pybart.pipeline.myb.mybtemplatecalibration.generate_template(raw_file, rejection_rate, l_freq, h_freq)¶

This function generate h5py(.h5) file to store the template de riemann

Parameters

  • raw_file (mne.io.Raw) – mne tools storing raw data from a BrainVision Recorder

  • rejection_rate (float) – Determined the rate of epochs rejection.

  • l_freq (float) – Low frequency of the pass band.

  • h_freq (float) – High frequency of the pass band.

pybart.pipeline.myb.mybtemplatecalibration.get_index_reject_epochs(epochs, rejection_rate)¶

This function removes Epochs from the Mne.Epochs object according a rate

Parameters

  • epochs (mne.Epochs) – mne tools storing all epochs before rejection

  • rejection_rate (float) – Determined the rate of epochs rejection.

pybart.pipeline.myb.mybtemplatecalibration.marking_target_events(raw_events, sequence_target)¶

This function marks targeted events thanks to a list of index

Parameters

  • raw_events (mne.io.Raw) – mne tools storing raw data from a BrainVision Recorder

  • sequence_target (list(int)) – list of target for each round of the calibration

pybart.pipeline.myb.mybtemplatecalibration.riemann_template_learn(file_complete_path, rejection_rate=0.15, l_freq=0.5, h_freq=20)¶

This function is generating a riemann template.

It take one .vhdr path in argument and return a dict containing all calibration data.

Riemann template is use to calibrate the MYB game.

Parameters

  • file_complete_path – Path to a “.vhdr” file.

  • rejection_rate (float) – Determined the rate of epochs rejection.

  • l_freq (float) – Low frequency of the pass band.

  • h_freq (float) – High frequency of the pass band.
